alert.note: Alert for Hanover; Louisa; Powhatan (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 28 at 3:56PM EDT until August 28 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central Virginia, including the following counties, in central Virginia, Goochland, Hanover, Louisa and Powhatan. In north central Virginia, Caroline. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 355 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is likely ongoing in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen during the past two hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area during the next 45 to 60 minutes. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Goochland, Bowling Green, Milford, Port Royal, Ladysmith, Kings Dominion, Montpelier, Wyndham, Oilville, Fort A.p. Hill, Noel, Hewlett, Cedar Fork, Oliver, Coatesville, Golansville, Ruther Glen, Doswell, Chilesburg and Beaverdam. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
